label: Untitled 4: Items list response (conversation/context scope metadata)
doc: A paginated API response returning an array of items, each carrying IDs, timestamps, flags, scope metadata, and a 'mapping' payload that links to the current node/template.

children.label: Pagination envelope
children.doc: Controls how many items are returned and where in the full result set this page starts.

children.label: total
children.doc: Total number of matching items across all pages.

children.label: limit
children.doc: Maximum number of items returned in this response.

children.label: offset
children.doc: Index into the full result set where this page begins.

children.label: items[] element schema
children.doc: Each item represents a single entity (likely a conversation/thread or similar object) with metadata and scope configuration.

children.label: Identity & references
children.doc: Stable identifiers and cross-links to templates/nodes.

children.label: id
children.doc: Primary identifier for the item.

children.label: conversation_template_id
children.doc: Associates item with a template definition.

children.label: gizmo_id
children.doc: Links item to a gizmo/agent/tool configuration.

children.label: sugar_item_id / sugar_item_visible
children.doc: Auxiliary IDs/visibility toggles (likely UI or feature-flag related).

children.label: Human-facing fields
children.doc: Text used for UI lists and previews.

children.label: title
children.doc: Display title for the item.

children.label: snippet
children.doc: Short preview/summary, used in list views.

children.label: Timestamps
children.doc: Lifecycle timestamps for creation, updates, and pinning.

children.label: create_time
children.doc: When the item was created.

children.label: update_time
children.doc: When the item was last updated.

children.label: pinned_time
children.doc: When the item was pinned (if pinned).

children.label: State flags
children.doc: UI and memory behavior toggles.

children.label: is_archived
children.doc: Whether the item is archived/hidden from active views.

children.label: is_starred
children.doc: Whether the item is starred/favorited.

children.label: is_do_not_remember
children.doc: Whether memory should be excluded for this item.

children.label: is_siloed
children.doc: Whether the item is siloed from broader context sharing.

children.label: Context scopes
children.doc: Defines which context namespaces/subscopes apply and how memory/visibility behave across workspaces.

children.label: context_scopes[]
children.doc: Primary scope list. Each entry includes namespace, sub-scope, and workspace binding.

children.label: scope fields
children.doc: Identifies where this item belongs and what context it can access.

children.label: context_scopes_v2
children.doc: A newer/alternate scope representation (may be redundant or migration-related). In the provided text it appears sometimes empty/malformed, suggesting partial serialization.

children.label: memory_scope
children.doc: Controls what parts of this item feed into long-term memory/recall.

children.label: URL safety lists
children.doc: Allow/deny lists for URLs associated with the item, likely used by the system when fetching or previewing external content.

children.label: safe_urls
children.doc: Explicitly allowed URLs.

children.label: blocked_urls
children.doc: Explicitly blocked URLs.

children.label: Mapping & node linkage
children.doc: Links the item to an internal graph/node representation for navigation and state.

children.label: mapping
children.doc: Mapping payload; may map external identifiers to internal node IDs.

children.label: current_node
children.doc: Pointer to the currently active node in the item's internal structure.

children.label: conversation_origin
children.doc: Where the item came from (imported, created, shared, etc.).

children.label: async_status
children.doc: Indicates background processing state (e.g., indexing, enrichment).

children.label: How this relates to other trees
children.doc: This item schema is the metadata envelope that higher-level 'WHAM' task/turn trees reference when they attach to a conversation template, current node, and context scopes.
